Introduction

Park Sunghoon is a South Korean singer-songwriter, dancer, and composer under Belift Lab. He is best known as the visual of the boy group ENHYPEN.

Sunghoon became a figure skater in 2010 and retired in 2020. Sunghoon is the 2016, 2017 junior silver medalist, and the 2015 novice gold medalist of the Asian Figure Skating Trophy, and the 2015 novice gold medalist of the Lombardia Trophy. He also won silver medals in the 2013 novice competition and at the 2014 junior competition of the South Korean Figure Skating Championships.

On June 1, 2020, Sunghoon was introduced as a contestant in the CJ ENM and Big Hit Entertainment's reality survival show I-LAND. On September 18, 2020, he ranked 6th place by global votes and became a member of the boy group ENHYPEN.

Sunghoon made his debut as a member of ENHYPEN on November 30, 2020, with their first mini album "Border : Day One".

2
Sunghoon originally did not want to become an idol. He was scouted by BigHit and accepted the offer because he thought the dance training would help his ice skating career.
